title: If Riot wants to add more strategic gameplay, add the dragon spawn order during pregame
body:
For example, If I know that there will be 1-2 early cloud drakes, I won't pick relentless hunter, or if I know that we can secure an ocean early on, maybe I don't need to take biscuits.

Dragon should be a point of strategy when deciding on runes, summoner spells, and champions, for how impactful it is.

replies.body: If I knew 3 mountain drakes were spawning, I'd know to pick inting Sion.
We're talking about this, no decision made yet though

Not a fan of showing the entire dragon order beforehand. Occluded spawn order rewards teams who can adapt to an in-game situation on the fly.

A workable compromise, imo, would be to show the first dragon spawn during champion select. It would give some amount of pre-game planning to team comps, based on the fact that both teams know at least one type of dragon that will spawn in the game, but still tests in-game strategic flexibility by having the rest of the dragons be occluded.

I both agree and disagree with this assessment. Mostly because yeah, it does remove some on-the-fly decision making... But on the other hand, on-the-fly decision making is already super simple and it's easy to have a priority set for nearly every game to begin with.

Knowing the dragon's that spawn in a given game give you more options to build a comp around specific dragon spawns. This offers teams at a high level more diversity in their champion choices because they can augment the champions they pick with Dragon's, rather than just getting random Dragon buffs on already generically good champions.

An example of this is something like, picking more immobile champions if you can secure multiple Cloud Drakes, versus picking more mobile bursty champions if there are multiple Fire drakes. Or even opting into a Poke composition knowing there are multiple Ocean drakes allowing for long sieges.

So while flexibility in-game would be lowered slightly, there would be more decisions to make and more control over the game from before you even load in. **Then, this is where the in-game flexibility comes back**, it's up to both teams to determine which drakes they need and when. They can make more decisions because they know the Drakes that will spawn, and they can choose to surrender certain Drakes for objectives with more knowledge of the game-state in the future rather than just hope that certain Drakes will spawn to benefit your composition.

The drafting phase is an important part of the game and drafting around Drakes is a positive, *not* a negative play pattern. Drafting for Drakes would promote more neutral objective fights, which is good for the game.
At least show the 1 drake type that won't spawn during the game.

It's better to have to adapt on the fly and not play the same perfectly solved strategy. 

Dragons are fine because they are _controlled_ randomness. It's a random dragon, sure, but it also spawns in the same place at a fixed timer and you know well in advance which one will spawn when you load in (3+ minutes in advance).  Basically, you're actually not adding strategy or depth to the game You're only going to cause one of two things:

A.) Dragons are strong enough that your team phase is completely decided by which one spawns, meaning that you don't actually have agency in your choice but rather are forced to build around the first dragon spawn.

B.) Dragons are weak/non-important enough that your draft isn't changed because picking around a dragon isn't as good as just picking a good team comp.

One situation is a balance problem, the other situation is it being a skill-problem just like how people were upset when they added jungle timers.  This solution doesn't solve any problem nor add any depth to the game. At best you're adding a non-factor which is completely arbitrary. At worst you're completely dictating the picks in the game because a dragon is so powerful it can decide a game. Which is the exact sort of thing players are usually against. 

Point is, Riot added random spawns so you don't just do the same thing literally every single game and have to adapt on the fly. This would completely remove that and add the binary choice of "Build team around dragon if it good dragon" or "Completely ignore dragon because it doesn't matter".

EDIT: Also this would mean your team can/will yell at champion picks. Why are you not picking an early game champ when the Infernal spawns first? Why are you not picking early game lane-winner bot lane when a mountain is spawning? Y'know. That thing boards _heavily_ criticizes Riot about in "you have to pick meta champs".
